results.title: That eye, the sky
results.creator_credit: Entertainment Media, Working Title Films, Peter Beilby, Grainne Marmion and John Ruane
results.brief_description: When twelve year old Ort Flack’s father Sam is plunged into a coma after a truck accident, his family is fractured. As Ort’s mother bravely tries to hold her family together, a mysterious stranger appears and changes their lives - giving Ort courage, comfort and faith. This acclaimed adaption of the novel by Tim Winton is about the healing power of love, about fantasy and faith, about a boy’s visions of the world beyond and about the blurry distinctions between the natural and the supernatural. Nominated for 9 AFI Awards and starring Peter Coyote, Lisa Harrow and Jamie Croft. Co-starring Amanda Douge, Mark Fairall and Alethea McGrath.

results.title: That dreaded phone call
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ruth Burleigh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ruth Burleigh reflects on the day she’ll have to make that dreaded call and put her beloved horse Boris ‘out to pasture’. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.

results.title: That certain age
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”
Discusses the times in a woman’s life when she is faced with change - change in family life when children grow up, change in feelings about herself, more self confident, but at the same time afraid that she is no longer attractive to men, and change in the biological sense of the menopause. It is a time when she’s either got everything she ever longed for, or has to face up to never having what she wants.

results.title: That all may learn
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The human story of a Mexican farmer and his family, who are exploited because they cannot read or write, is used as a case to stress the need for education of all the peoples the world over. Unesco’s part in correcting these conditions is portrayed.

results.title: That 'Boy meets girl' thing compilation
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: 4 shorts united by the theme of the unique male/female relationship dynamic. “Hot date” (dir. Kelly Wallwork): A woman out on a first date learns the hard way not to order the nachos with chillies. “Risk” (prod. Hugh Burton, dir. Christian Bernardi): Looi Prescott has asked a sexy waitress out to lunch. Does he act like his true self and consume the Creme Caramel as he is accustomed to? “Slave to love” (dir. Caroline Toomey): An elderly woman writes a hit romance novel, despite the distractions worthy of any juicy plot. “The Drive home” (dir. Annette Trevitt): While driving home a woman hears on the radio how to recognise your perfect match, provided she can make it through the tunnel and pick up radio frequency.

results.title: That's the price
results.creator_credit: William Canning, ONF | NFB and Michael Scott
results.brief_description: Two points of view concerning what the infusion of industrial capital meant to two dying coal towns in southeastern British Columbia. The film shows what happened when an American corporation came to the twin towns of Natal and Michel with a contract for millions of tons of coking coal for the steel mills of Japan. From what is seen and said in this film, industrial growth has its price, especially with regard to the ecology of the region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Canning, ONF | NFB and Michael Scott

results.title: That's surfing
results.brief_description: This comprehensive documentary looks at Australia’s long running love affair with the ocean and in particular, with surfing. The evolution of the modern surfboard is traced, as well as the emergence of surfing films, music, magazines and surfwear fashion industries. We see the surfboard manufacturing industries that have emerged in coastal towns such as Torquay where surfer-craftsmen experiment in their eternal quest for the perfect board. The development of the Australian surfing subculture is shown, from the influential U.S. surfers who arrived at the 1956 Olympic Games with their Malibu boards, to the female surfers in the 60’s who were largely disregarded unless they were tandem surfing with male partners. This culture is not only embraced by groups of mates who tour beaches in their panel vans but increasingly by the professional surfers who move around the world touring circuits from the Seychelles to Bali, and take out world titles in Hawaii. Historic clashes surfers have had with authorities are presented, as well as music clips of Australian surfing songs from Little Pattie, Col Joye, The Delltones, Normie Rowe and Johnny O’Keefe. The program is a blend of historical surfing footage, interview clips and cameo appearances from most of Australia’s surfing greats from the 1950’s through to the 1990’s including Midge Farrelly, Nat Young, Layne Beachley, Kelly Slater and Mark Occhilupo.

results.title: That's stealing
results.creator_credit: Sandra Schieck, Thom Eberhardt, FilmFair Communications and Tony Schmitz
results.brief_description: An open ended program designed to promote discussion about the nature of friendship and trust in relation to the possible theft of a bracelet by one girl from a friend. Useful in circumstances where theft occurs in classrooms.

results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.
